rooms

Class Door

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameMembers.Drawable
      • gameMembers.EnvironmentMember
        • rooms.Door

  • public class Door
extends EnvironmentMember
    This class is meant to represent a door.
    Doors are unmoving objects that exist in corners of the room and change rooms when they are touched.
    Each door possessses a DoorDirection member of the DoorDirection enum. When constructing an Door object a direction is given (left, right, up, down).
    The Door will place itself in the correct location in the room based its location.
    This class extends the EnvironmentMember class so that it can intersect the main character for switching rooms.
    Author:
    Hughes
    See Also:
    EnvironmentMember

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Door.DoorDirection
      This enum is possessed by the Door class with the intent of giving a direction to any Door which is kind of important in a square room.

    • Field Detail

      • dir

        public Door.DoorDirection dir
        This is the direction of the door. A LEFT door location value will put the Door halfway up the left wall, for example.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Door

        public Door(Door.DoorDirection dir)
        This is the only constructor for the class. The only parameter is the door direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction of the Door, or which wall the Door should be on. A Door.DoorDirection variable.
